commits.message:

Merge pull request #1 from r-s-l/master

rpi-kb.patch changes

issue_comments.body:
What platform are you on? It seems you haven't changed a lot in the makefile but the diff shows all lines have changed. It's quite difficult to see changes then. I expect different line endings? Could you try to recommit with different line endings?
This is what file says about the current Makefile:

```
$ file Makefile 
Makefile: makefile script, ASCII text, with very long lines, with CRLF line terminators
```

What does yours say?
Then strange that I can't merge this pr. Is your repo in sync with this one? Can you do a git pull of master of this repo?

When running in X this is not the case... perhaps its an issue with the version of SDL:
https://github.com/vanfanel/SDL12-kms-dispmanx/pull/4
Seems we do need the data dir. The RASPBERRYPI target loads the fixedfont.bmp while other targets load the TTF's. I couldn't find a working fixedfont.bmp yet

It seems at least the following files are needed:
- fixedfont.bmp
- supersonic640.jpg
- logo_uae4all.jpg
- amiga-wallpaper-3.jpg
I've tried the patch and I do get a cursor but just on a black screen. Reverted the patch and I also just have a black screen. I don't have a working binary in any way.

issues.title: flickering black square cursor in gui

issue_comments.body:
hi sphaero

i'm on rpi/raspbian using vim.
i don't think it has to do with line endings
because "file Makefile" shows no such issue here.

"$ file Makefile
Makefile: makefile script, ASCII text"

mainly i did the following changes:
- reordered a lot of lines to make it more readable
- removed unused logic like the fame stuff selection
- removed armv7 and neon stuff, rpi is armv6
- axed double enabled optimization flags
- used -O2 instead of -O3 as it swaps a lot when building on rpi
- used sound_sdl_new for proper sound
ah ok! my fork was not in sync, please try again.
there are reports of users having gamepads working.

hi
i meant adding the missing things from my tarball release
like kickstarts and data dir etc. (minus prebuilt binary)
so you can actually _run_ the selfbuilt binary. :)
with these in place you can close issue #9 too. ;)

cheers!

ttf rendering is somehow broken on rpi, so amigagamer and
lubomyr used fixedfonts. this was done on abime forum some
time ago.
please see my issue #8 comment.

hi sphaero

as installing the sdl devlibs via apt drags in a _lot_ of
unused stuff here (i have a minimal raspbian install
without x), i would propose:

---

HowTo build UAE4All for Raspberry Pi from source

## Clone the uae4all-rpi git repo

git clone https://github.com/sphaero/uae4all-rpi.git
cd uae4all-rpi
git init submodules
git update submodules
--> @sphaero, please add your hosted guichan gitrepo as a submodule too

## Build SDL (dispmanx)

cd SDL12-kms-dispmanx
./MAC_ConfigureDISPMANX.sh
make && sudo make install

## Build guichan (patched)

cd guichan
./configure
make && sudo make install

## Get and build SDL_image

wget https://www.libsdl.org/projects/SDL_image/release/SDL_image-1.2.12.tar.gz
tar -xzf SDL_image-1.2.12.tar.gz
cd SDL_image-1.2.12
./autogen.sh && ./configure
make && sudo make install

## Get and build SDL_ttf

wget https://www.libsdl.org/projects/SDL_ttf/release/SDL_ttf-2.0.11.tar.gz
tar -xzf SDL_ttf-2.0.11.tar.gz
cd SDL_ttf-2.0.11/
./autogen.sh && ./configure
make && sudo make install

## Get and build SDL_gfx

wget http://www.ferzkopp.net/Software/SDL_gfx-2.0/SDL_gfx-2.0.25.tar.gz
tar -xzf SDL_gfx-2.0.25.tar.gz
cd SDL_gfx-2.0.25/
./autogen.sh && ./configure --disable-mmx
make && sudo make install

## You may need the following devlibs installed too, so

sudo apt-get install libpng12-dev libwebp-dev zlib1g-dev

## Finally compile uae4all

make

## FIN :)

issue_comments.body: This wpuld be a great feature!

My single button Amiga Joystick (with Retrolink Adapter) is detected as button index 0, and is not functionnal in UAE4ALL. Does nothing. It seems that working button for "Fire" on a PC standard gamepad is button index 2.
